hypothesis_content.title: SOL Volatility Expansion Post-Drawdown
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a >15% 7-day drawdown in SOL price during BULL regimes, SOL's 10-day realized volatility will expand by at least 30% relative to pre-drawdown levels within the next 5 trading days, providing long volatility opportunities.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In bull markets, SOL drawdowns often represent profit-taking rather than trend reversal. Subsequent volatility expansion occurs as traders reposition and uncertainty about continuation vs. reversal creates two-sided trading activity.
entry_conditions: SOL experiences >15% 7-day drawdown from recent high
Enter long SOL volatility position at next daily close after drawdown condition met

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10-day realized volatility increases 30% from entry level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: SOL price recovers to within 5% of pre-drawdown high without volatility expansion

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility remains suppressed or continues declining post-drawdown in majority of cases.
